data.name: Tower Hop
data.description:
You are given a list of integers between 0 and 9 (inclusive) with the length of n:

    example: [4, 2, 0, 1, 3, 2]

Every integer represents a tower (or the height of it).
Vizualized the previous example would look like this:

       _
      |_|          _
      |_| _       |_| _ 
      |_||_|    _ |_||_|
      |_||_|   |_||_||_|

Now there is a person standing on top of the first tower.
He wants to get to the other side of the towers.
He however can't climb up the towers, he needs to jump from tower to tower.
His ability to jump depends on the height of the tower, a tower with the height of 4, allows him to jump to the next four towers (regardless of their height).

This means, in the given example he is able to jump from the tower of index 0 to towers with indices of 1, 2, 3 or 4.

It is your job to write a function to decide whether it is doable or not (meaning return True or False) to get to the index after the last tower or further.

Examples:

    tower_hop([4, 2, 0, 1, 3, 2]) => True
    because he can (for example) hop from 0 to 4 to 6 (6 is out of bounds and thus counts as finished, 5 would not count)
    
    tower_hop([1, 0, 3, 5, 6]) => False
    
    tower_hop([0, 1, 1, 1, 1]) => False
    
    tower_hop([1, 9, 3, 3, 3, 0]) => True

You can always expect valid input with a maximum length of 100.
